Your presence demands attention and respect, rallying the pack at the moment of greatest danger.

When you roll initiative, you may choose a number of allied creatures within 30 feet of you equal to your proficiency bonus (including yourself). Until the end of each chosen creature’s first turn in this combat, that creature has advantage on the first attack roll or saving throw it makes during that turn (its choice).

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Auspice Interaction

When you use Regal Bearing, choose one of the affected allies to gain an additional benefit based on your Auspice.

Ragabash — Shadowed Command

The chosen ally may take the Hide action as a bonus action on their first turn.

This enables repositioning, ambush play, and misdirection without raw damage gain.

Theurge — Warded by Luna

The chosen ally has advantage on the first saving throw it makes against a spell or supernatural effect before the end of its first turn.

“Supernatural effect” is intentionally broader than spells, catching monster abilities, curses, and magical hazards.

Philodox — Weight of Authority

The chosen ally has advantage on the first contested ability check it makes before the end of its first turn.

This cleanly covers grapples, shoves, social contests, and control moments.

Galliard — Stirring Cry

The chosen ally gains temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

This is modest, scales naturally, and reinforces the inspirational role.

Ahroun — Battle Standard

The chosen ally gains a +2 bonus to damage on the first successful weapon attack it hits with before the end of its first turn.

Specifying “weapon attack” avoids spell abuse and keeps this in line with martial burst.
